overview.title: Card Anatomy
overview.description: Every Magic card follows a standard layout with specific areas that contain crucial game information. Understanding each part helps you play more effectively.
overview.importance: Knowing where to find information on a card is essential for quick gameplay and understanding complex interactions.

manaCost.name: Mana Cost
manaCost.description: Shows the mana required to cast the spell. Includes both the total amount and specific colour requirements.
components: Coloured mana (coloured symbols: W, U, B, R, G)
Hybrid mana (symbols split between two colours)
Generic mana (can be paid with any colour)
readingTips: Always pay the full mana cost to cast
Colour requirements must be met exactly
Total mana value includes all symbols
Some costs include special symbols (X, hybrid, Phyrexian)

cardName.name: Card Name
cardName.description: The official name of the card, used for game rules and deck construction.
importance: Used for deck building limits (max 4 copies)
Legendary rule applies to permanents with same name
Some cards care about specific names
specialCases: Legendary cards have a crown symbol
Some cards reference other cards by name

typeLine.name: Type Line
typeLine.location: Middle of the card, below the art
typeLine.description: Lists the card's types, subtypes, and supertypes, determining how it functions in the game.
gameplayImpact: Tribal effects care about creature types
Some spells only target certain types

rulesText.name: Rules Text (Text Box)
rulesText.description: Contains the card's abilities, effects, and any special rules that apply when it's in play.
readingTips: Read abilities carefully for timing restrictions
Reminder text explains keywords for newer players
Flavour text has no game effect
Some abilities only work in specific zones

powerToughness.name: Power/Toughness
powerToughness.description: Shows a creature's combat statistics - how much damage it deals and how much it can take.
explanation: Both can be modified by spells and abilities
Damage is removed at end of turn
specialCases: X = Variable based on game state
0 power creatures can still have useful abilities
High toughness creatures are hard to remove
strategicNotes: Some spells care about power or toughness
Combat tricks can modify these values

loyaltyCounters.name: Loyalty (Planeswalkers only)
loyaltyCounters.description: Shows a planeswalker's starting loyalty and current loyalty counters.
explanation: Can be attacked like a player
loyaltyAbilities: Ultimate abilities usually cost lots of loyalty

setSymbol.name: Set Symbol
setSymbol.location: Right side, between type line and text box
setSymbol.description: Indicates which set the card was printed in and its rarity.
usefulness: Helps identify card legality in formats
Some formats care about specific sets

artBox.name: Artwork
artBox.description: Visual representation of the card's concept, providing flavour and atmosphere.
artBox.artistCredit: Artist name appears in small text below the art box

whatToLookFor: Can be cast at instant speed

readingTips: Always read the card name and mana cost first
Check the type line to understand what kind of card it is
Read abilities completely before making decisions
Remember that reminder text explains keywords
Pay attention to timing restrictions on abilities
Some abilities only work in specific zones
When in doubt, ask or look up the card online

layoutVariations.description: Standard card layout used for most cards
Two spells on one card, can cast either half
Card flips upside down when conditions are met
Double-faced card that transforms between sides
Multiple loyalty abilities instead of regular text
